021package com.bewsoftware.utils;
022
023import java.util.Objects;
024import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
025import java.util.function.Consumer;
026
027/**
028 * Represents an operation that accepts three input arguments and returns no
029 * result. This is the three-arity specialization of {@link Consumer}. Unlike
030 * most other functional interfaces, {@code TriConsumer} is expected
031 * to operate via side-effects.
032 * <p>
033 * This is a {@link FunctionalInterface functional interface}
034 * whose functional method is {@link #accept(Object, Object, Object)}.
035 *
036 * @apiNote
037 * The text and code for this interface were originally copied from the JDK
038 * 16 {@link BiConsumer} interface, and modified by me to provide the third
039 * parameter.
040 *
041 * @param <T> the type of the first argument to the operation
042 * @param <U> the type of the second argument to the operation
043 * @param <V> the type of the third argument to the operation
044 *
045 * @see Consumer
046 * @author <a href="mailto:bw.opensource@yahoo.com">Bradley Willcott</a>
047 *
048 * @since 1.0.9
049 * @version 1.0.9
050 */
051@FunctionalInterface
052public interface TriConsumer<T, U, V>
053{
054
055    /**
056     * Performs this operation on the given arguments.
057     *
058     * @param t the first input argument
059     * @param u the second input argument
060     * @param v the third input argument
061     */
062    void accept(T t, U u, V v);
063
064    /**
065     * Returns a composed {@code TriConsumer} that performs, in sequence, this
066     * operation followed by the {@code after} operation. If performing either
067     * operation throws an exception, it is relayed to the caller of the
068     * composed operation. If performing this operation throws an exception,
069     * the {@code after} operation will not be performed.
070     *
071     * @param after the operation to perform after this operation
072     *
073     * @return a composed {@code TriConsumer} that performs in sequence this
074     *         operation followed by the {@code after} operation
075     *
076     * @throws NullPointerException if {@code after} is null
077     */
078    default TriConsumer<T, U, V> andThen(TriConsumer<? super T, ? super U, ? super V> after)
079    {
080        Objects.requireNonNull(after);
081
082        return (t, u, v) ->
083        {
084            accept(t, u, v);
085            after.accept(t, u, v);
086        };
087    }
088}
